I found backgammon on
playsite.com. I just signed on with pogo.com as well. They have the rules to

messages.subject: backgammon & smoking
messages.msgSnippet: ... really understood it myself, so I can t help the kids with it, and haven t come across a rulebook for it in the second hand store yet.) FWIW, I already
messages.messageBody:
>>>>DEBI WROTE: We play the rest (except for backgammon -- I never
really understood it myself, so I can't help the kids with it, and
haven't come across a rulebook for it in the second hand store yet.)
FWIW, I already knew how to play, but I found backgammon on
playsite.com. there is a link to the rules, plus your kids could
just dive in and TRY to play with other online gamers and figure it
out on their own. It's really not that complicated a game. I think
there's even a way to watch another game in progress!
I just signed on with pogo.com as well. They have the rules to
backgammon, if you or your kids are interested!

>>>>NED WROTE: If you want to quit smoking, do you smoke the rest of
the pack just because you've paid for them? -- Yup! I have done
that several times (hopefully I'm really off them now!) *wink*

I know this has nothing to do with swim classes, I just thought it
was funny! *L*
TATE
=o)
